messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

- Full HTTP request path:
  /comments/{comment}

- All HTTP methods acceptable:
  false

- HEAD:
  false

- POST:
  false

- OPTIONS:
  false

- TRACE:
  false

- GET:
  false

- PUT:
  false

- DELETE:
  true

- PATCH:
  false

Explanation:
- The CommentController::destroy method is the non-admin controller (App\Http\Controllers\CommentController). In routes/auth.php there is Route::resource('comments', CommentController::class)->only(['store', 'destroy']); inside the auth+verified middleware group. A resource destroy route maps to DELETE /comments/{comment}, so the path is /comments/{comment} and the route parameter name is {comment}, matching the controller type-hint (Comment $comment).
- Only the DELETE verb is defined for this controller method by the resource route. The store action (POST) exists but is bound to POST /comments (a different route), not to the destroy path.
- No other HTTP methods (GET/HEAD/PUT/PATCH/OPTIONS/TRACE/POST) are defined for this endpoint in the provided route definitions, so they are not acceptable based on the code.
